roleset.name: to say or take a note of

example.name: note-v: transitive
example.text: Mr. Rowe noted that political concerns also worried New England Electric
example.arg: that political concerns also worried New England Electric

example.name: note-v: fronted
example.text: [Shipments have been relatively level]-1, the Commerce Dept noted *trace*-1

example.name: note-v: inverted
example.text: [Some companies have bought back stock]-1, notes *trace*-1 Steven G. Einhorn.

example.name: note-v: empty, sorta discourse-level
example.text: Except where noted *trace* *trace-3*, blah blah blah

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Tan notes that although DRAM factories are closing one after another in the US , patent royalties must still be paid to Texas Instruments for each and every one of the more than 100 million DRAMs produced around the world annually .
example.arg: that although DRAM factories are closing one after another in the US , patent royalties must still be paid to Texas Instruments for each and every one of the more than 100 million DRAMs produced around the world annually

example.name: ARG1
example.text: However , it should be noted , there are after all great ideological differences between the DPP and the other parties .

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG3
example.text: The poll also noted fear of a takeover as a stress - producing event in larger companies .
example.arg: as a stress - producing event in larger companies

example.name: note-v: Medical note, single argument
example.text: [The patient]-1 was noted to have shingles.

roleset.name: noticed as remarkable, famed for

example.name: note-v: ah, the Lonesome Dove
example.text: Qintex Entertainment, [a producer and distributor of television programs]-1 most noted [*]-1 for its co-production of the hit miniseries ``Lonesome Dove,'' said it filed for Chapter 11 protection after Qintex Australia failed to provide it with $5.9 million owed to MCA Inc. in connection with the distribution of ``The New Leave It to Beaver Show.''
example.arg: for its co-production of the hit miniseries ``Lonesome Dove,''

example.name: note-n: arg 1
example.text: note of the growing problem of computer fraud
example.arg: of the growing problem of computer fraud

roleset.note: NOTE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to note.02-v.xml. VN class sight-30.2. Framed by Katie. (from note.01-n)
NOTED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from noted.02-j)

roleset.name: noticed as remarkable, famed for

example.name: noteworthy-j
example.text: The nicotine–body weight relationship is noteworthy to us for a couple of reasons.

roleset.note: NOTEWORTHY-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from noteworthy.02-j)

roleset.name: worthy of notice, significant

example.name: notable-j: args 1, 2
example.text: The prolific seventies American stand-up, George Carlin, was notable for his routines on taboo subjects and dark humour, but he will go down in controversial-comedian history for his ?Seven Dirty Words? routine, which pre-empted the seven most offensive swear words for US television.
example.arg: The prolific seventies American stand-up, George Carlin,
for his routines on taboo subjects and dark humour,

example.name: notable-j: all args
example.text: This years PPE was notable to me because of the sheer number of youngsters playing all the different games.
example.arg: because of the sheer number of youngsters playing all the different games.

roleset.note: NOTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, relation to note-v.01, note-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls sight-30.2. (from notable.01-j)
